item.title: French election projections show voters punishing Macron’s centrists, boosting far right
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack, Emily Rauhala, Annabelle Timsit, Anthony Faiola
item.description: Snap legislative elections could end French President Emmanuel Macron’s centrist political experiment and bring Marine Le Pen’s far-right party to power.

item.title: Gaza’s remaining hospitals will stop working in two days, health officials warn
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan, Claire Parker, Sarah Dadouch, Heidi Levine
item.description: Israel’s closure of the vital Rafah border crossing last month severed key supply lines, aid groups warned. Fighting goes on in Shejaiya, Gaza City, the IDF said.

item.title: Hurricane Beryl tracker: Map and projected storm path
item.dc:creator: Nick Kirkpatrick, Dylan Moriarty, Szu Yu Chen
item.description: Beryl is expected to bring life-threatening winds and storm surge to the Windward Islands

item.title: The French far right is leading in election polls. Here’s what to know.
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: France’s far-right National Rally party hopes to win an outright majority in National Assembly elections that begin on Sunday.

item.title: How one family escaped North Korea in a rickety boat on the open sea
item.dc:creator: Michelle Lee
item.description: Almost no one has been able to defect from North Korea since Kim Jong Un shut the borders in 2020. But this family made a terrifying bid for freedom — and succeeded.

item.title: U.S. suspends Gaza aid pier again; fighting continues in Shejaiya
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman, Victoria Bisset, Mohamad El Chamaa
item.description: U.S.-built pier is again suspended due to high seas, says Pentagon. The U.N. warns “at least 60,000 people” have been displaced from Gaza’s Shejaiya area as fighting continues.

item.title: The far right was humiliated in this city. Its return bodes ill for Macron.
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: The port city of Toulon helps explain the far right’s appeal in France and, critics say, the risks of entrusting it with government responsibilities.

item.title: Iran heads to presidential runoff pitting reformist against conservative
item.dc:creator: Susannah George
item.description: Turnout in the first round of voting hit a historic low. But some people hope the pro-reform candidate’s will mobilize voters ahead of the runoff July 5.

item.title: In Egypt, Gaza evacuees live in the shadows: ‘Everything is closing in’
item.dc:creator: Claire Parker, Lorenzo Tugnoli, Hazem Balousha
item.description: Displaced Palestinians in Cairo have found sanctuary from war and a measure of calm, but are unable to build a future.

item.title: Airline apologizes after plane left passengers in wheelchairs on tarmac
item.dc:creator: Daniel Wu
item.description: An EasyJet flight left Belfast as Liz Weir, who uses a wheelchair, waited on the tarmac to board.
